abstract: CIA drone strike kills three men suspected of being members of Al Qaeda in Arabian Peninsula, tentatively identified as Awaid al-Rashidi, Abdullah Khaled al-Zindani and Mohammed Toiman al-Jahmi; drone strike, first since resignation of Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour after Houthi takeover of capital, hints that United States plans to continue its targeted killing operations in Yemen.
lead_paragraph: The drone strike was a signal that the United States will continue its targeted killing operations in Yemen despite the apparent takeover in the country by Houthi fighters.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and Mona El-Naggar from Sana, Yemen. Reporting was contributed by Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt from Washington, Kareem Fahim from Baghdad and Shuaibal Mosawi from Sana.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MONA EL-NAGGAR

snippet: The drone strike was a signal that the United States will continue its targeted killing operations in Yemen despite the apparent takeover in the country by Houthi fighters.

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: U.S. Drone Kills 3 Qaeda Operatives in Yemen, Continuing Policy on Strikes
headline.print_headline: U.S. Drone Kills 3 Qaeda Operatives in Yemen, Continuing Policy on Strikes
